{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3496222,"name":"Nathaniel","username":"nexnot","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/58f4c7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T01:08:56.997Z","cooked":"

Hi, we’ve been getting an error in the build.gradle file of our code. On one computer, no error appears, but on all others, the code won’t build.

Unresolved dependency: choreo:ChoreoLib-java:2025.0.2

We also get this build error in terminal:

Executing task: gradlew build -Dorg.gradle.java.home=“C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2025\jdk”

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

  • Where: Build file ‘C:\Users\Rancho Robos\Documents\GitHub\RanchoReapers_2025\8533_RanchoReapers_2025\build.gradle’ line: 90
  • What went wrong: Could not determine the dependencies of task ‘:jar’.

Could not resolve all files for configuration ‘:runtimeClasspath’. Could not resolve choreo:ChoreoLib-java:2025.0.2. Required by: root project : > Could not resolve choreo:ChoreoLib-java:2025.0.2. > Could not get resource ‘https://lib.choreo.autos/dep/choreo/ChoreoLib-java/2025.0.2/ChoreoLib-java-2025.0.2.pom’. > Could not GET ‘https://lib.choreo.autos/dep/choreo/ChoreoLib-java/2025.0.2/ChoreoLib-java-2025.0.2.pom’. > Got SSL handshake exception during request. It might be caused by SSL misconfiguration > PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target

BUILD FAILED in 4s

Removing ChoreoLib 2025.0.2 from the vendor dependencies on the affected computers fixes the error, and the code is then able to build. We aren’t able to figure out why it works on one computer but fails on all the others, any suggestions?

It looks like ur network is intercepting and blocking the connection to their repository. Our school does the same, also pathplanner and maple sim which are GitHub.io domains. We ended up self hosting our our mirror of all 3.

That’s an excellent idea. The computer that works was connected to a VPN – can’t believe we didn’t realize that this might be the issue, lol. I’ll investigate when I’m back on campus tomorrow to see if using a different network fixes the error, and we’ll probably have to look into self-hosting those domains. Thank you so much for your help!

No problem. You’re welcome to see if our clone works for u. It’s easy to add, FRC2025/build.gradle at main · Frc5572/FRC2025 · GitHub

We have ours update from the upstream repos 2x daily.
